trans-unit.source: Represents the location of a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance specified with a unique network address configuration by describing the current instance of a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> or <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> within the Peer-to-Peer Collaboration Infrastructure.

A peer "endpoint" describes a contact's presence location â€” the unique network address configuration that describes the currently available instance of the contact within the peer collaboration network.
A single contact can be available at multiple endpoints within the peer collaboration network.
A peer watching a contact can query any of the endpoints associated with that contact for specific peer presence, application, or object updates.
Generates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> class with the peer-associated endpoint contained in <xref:System.Net.IPEndPoint>.
The endpoint associated with the peer.
Initializes a new instance of the class with the peer-associated endpoint contained in and a string specifying endPointName.
The endpoint associated with the peer.
Specifies the name associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The endPoint argument specifies .
The endPoint specified is not a valid IPv6 endpoint.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance with the associated parameters required for serialization.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The serialization destination associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object and optionally releases the managed resources.

Set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the <xref:System.Net.IPEndPoint> that contains the IP address associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance.

To avoid corrupting the instance state, the caller should not change the EndPoint value if the instance was obtained from <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe> or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
IP address associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance.
The specified EndPoint endpoint is not a valid IPv6 endpoint.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance to test for equality.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance provided has matching data, else <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> to the specified <xref:System.Object>.
The <xref:System.Object> to test for equality.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> is equal to the specified object instance, else <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> objects are considered equal.
The first <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> to compare.

Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instances provided have matching data, else <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns the hash code for a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code used to compare instances of this type.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.

Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> class instance with the data required to serialize the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObject"></xref> instance.
A derived type must call the base type <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData*> method.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination for the serialization.
Gets or sets a <xref:System.String> that represents a displayed name for the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance.

To avoid corrupting the instance state, the caller should not change the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.EndPoint%2A> value if the instance was obtained from <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe> or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
<xref:System.String> representing the display name of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
Signaled when the name associated with a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object changes.
To be added.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
Called when a change occurs to the PeerName specified by the associated with the instance.
Specifies the type of change that has occurred to the `PeerName`.

When this property value is set, all events not fired as the result of an asynchronous operation will have the associated event handlers called back on the thread that created the specific SynchronizingObject.
The default set value for this property is `null`, indicating that all event handlers are called on a system thread pool thread.
This property is typically set to a UI element such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> instance.

Object that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke"></xref> interface and is used by instances of this type for event handler synchronization on the thread that created it.
The calling object has been disposed.
Populates the current <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance with the data obtained from the serialized source.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination for the serialization.
Returns a <xref:System.String> that represents a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> instance.
<xref:System.String> representing a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref> object has been disposed.
